title: Ciara pays tribute to Beyonce and Jay Z with incredible Halloween costume

Singer Ciara has paid the ultimate tribute to Beyonce and Jay Z with her Halloween costume.

Ciara and her husband Russell Wilson transformed themselves into music's biggest power couple.

They imitated the iconic video for Beyonce and Jay Z's track Apes**t.

In the video, Beyonce and Jay Z both wear silk trouser suits with a ton of bling and stand in front of the Mona Lisa - they even rented out the Louvre to pull this off.

Ciara, 34, and American football player Russell, 30, replicated the outfits perfectly, right down to the hairstyles.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: beyonce/Instagram)

But instead of the Mona Lisa, Ciara and Russell pose in front of a framed picture of former US president and first lady, Barack and Michelle Obama.

Ciara posted a photo on Twitter , and received a fantastic reaction from her fans.

One wrote: "Ya’ll not only win at Halloween but y’all win at life. HOW? LOOK AT YA’LL. I can’t. This is legendary. Wow."

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"I love it, especially the Obamas in the background", said another.

"You win Halloween" declared a third.

She also posted a video on Instagram which replicated the shots from Bey and Jay's video, along with their song.

(Image: Instagram)

Alongside this she wrote: "From the Wilsons to the Carters to the Obamas... Much Love & Respect. We goin Ape $#!% #HappyHalloween ".

Ciara and Russell married in 2015 in Cheshire, having been dating for just over a year.

They share a two-year-old daughter together, Sienna Princess Wilson.

(Image: Getty Images North America)

Ciara also has a five-year-old son from her relationship with rapper Future, who is called Future Zahir Wilburn.

The two kids also dressed up for Halloween, as the Jacksons when they were children.

Ciara posted photos of the tots looking adorable holding microphones and singing along to ABC.
description: Ciara and her hubbie Russell Wilson paid homage to Beyonce and Jay Z by replicating one of their iconic music videos
